moves.1. d4:
Started annotating this around move 25.
Started out trying to play the Stonewall Dutch against the d4 opening
Never got to play a standard Stonewall 
Has been an interesting game - some blunders on my part.
moves.1... f5 2. e3 d5: maybe should have played e6 - later was hard to play e6
moves.3. Nf3 Nf6 4. c4: went with c6 - could have done e6
moves.4... c6 5. Ne5 Nbd7: want to trade off that White Knight on e5
moves.6. cxd5 cxd5: cxd5 was somewhat unexpected - kind of different style
moves.7. g3: looks like White will finchetto the white square bishop
moves.7... Nxe5 8. dxe5 Ne4: was planning Ne4 at some point anyway
moves.12. Bxc5: didnot expect White to trade a bishop for a knight,  If I was playing white and wanted to chase the knight, would have considered b4.  bxc5 gives me connected pawns in the center
moves.12... bxc5 13. fxe4: Don't want to capture dxe4 - gives me isolated stacked pawns
moves.13... d4 14. Qf3: White Qg3 -This is a problem - will be hard to castle kingside and queenside is not appealing
moves.14... e6: Wish I had done this sooner
moves.15. Nd2 Qa5: Qa5 - not sure if this is a good move
moves.16. Bc4 Be7: thinking white could castle resulting in a battery of Queen and Rook - would leave the knight open
moves.19. Qxe6+ Kd8 20. Rf2: my next move is a blunder.  If white does Rf7 - that would create a lot of pressure on me
moves.20... Qe3: While Qe3 pins the rook - did not see the check/attack on the rook - should have traded queens
moves.21. Qd5+: I think I am in trouble now
moves.21... Kc7 22. Qxa8: Really in trouble now - about to try a hail mary - will trade the remaining rook for a shot at checkmate - Bb7 Qxh8, Qxe4  followed by Qh1# .  If he sees it and does Kf1, will get the rook back
moves.22... Bb7 23. Qxh8 Qxe4 24. Kf1: so I will get the rook back after Qh1+
moves.24... Qh1+ 25. Ke2 Qxa1:
back to -2 - could be a wild game
Think I have a shot if I keep up a series of checks with the Queen and the Bishops
Have to be careful to avoid another blunder
I anticipate Kd3 so that the Rook will defend the b pawn.  Response would be Qd1+
moves.26. Kd3 Qd1+: got to keep checking - could lose the black square bishop otherwise
moves.27. Rd2 Qf1+ 28. Re2 Qf3+: continuing with the checks - keeping queen on 3rd rank forces a retreat
moves.29. Kd2 Bg5+: get the black square bishop involved - however will lose it as soon as I don't check.  Think I can win both the rook and the bishop for the black square bishop
moves.30. Kd1 Qf1+:
Kc2 will cause problems for me long term - still think I can win - have to avoid taking the Rook since it is guarded by the bishop - will have to take the bishp first

if Kc2, I will lose the ability to continue the checks at some point - one sceanrio even had black being checkmated - Kc2  Qc1, Kb3 Qd1, Ka3  now what - Bc6 threating mate with Qa4.  That would allow White  Qxg7+ with Q attack on g5
moves.31. Kc2 Qc1+ 32. Kb3 Qd1+ 33. Ka3 Kb6 34: Will give up the Black square bishop for a shot at checkmate
moves.35. Qxg5 Qa4#: He takes the bishop but gives me checkmate
